medical_history.chief_complaint: 5 day history of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain and fevers.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began 5 days ago with cramping RUQ pain and fever. The patient started experiencing cramps, diarrhea, and vomiting on the evening of the third day. She reported feeling fatigued and generally unwell since then. She was not eating on the fourth and fifth days and had a fever of 102°F. There was a slight improvement yesterday, allowing her to start eating again, but after lunch, cramps returned, and her temperature was 101°F. The RUQ pain is cramping and intermittent, worsening with meals. At presentation, the patient felt no pain unless the RUQ was pressed.
medical_history.family_history: Father had heart problems and had gall bladder removed. Mother had diabetes. Brothers died of colon cancer, lung cancer, brain cancer. Sister died of stroke.
